homes_hear_details: Florida has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services (FDACS), Office of Energy, is the designated administrator. Florida's participation has been uncertain due to political dynamics around federal climate spending.
state_energy_office: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, Office of Energy

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Florida, 80% of Area Median Income varies significantly by county. In Miami-Dade County, 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $58,600. In Orange County (Orlando), it is approximately $57,500.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Florida, 150% of Area Median Income in Miami-Dade County for a family of four is approximately $109,900. In Orange County (Orlando), it is approximately $107,800.

net_metering: Florida has net metering under Florida Administrative Code 25-6.065. Residential systems up to 2 MW qualify. Customers receive credits at the full retail rate for excess generation. Credits roll forward monthly. Multiple attempts to weaken or eliminate net metering (e.g., HB 741 in 2022, vetoed by the governor) have been made but net metering remains in place as of early 2026.

state_rebate_programs.name: Residential Property Tax Exemption for Renewable Energy
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Florida Department of Revenue (via local property appraisers)
state_rebate_programs.amount: 100% property tax exemption for the added value of a renewable energy system
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Solar PV, solar thermal, wind, and other qualifying renewable energy systems installed on residential property
state_rebate_programs.details: Florida exempts the added value of residential renewable energy systems from property tax assessment. This means installing solar panels will not increase your property tax bill. This is a constitutional amendment (Article VII, Section 3(d)).

state_rebate_programs.name: Sales Tax Exemption for Solar Energy Systems
state_rebate_programs.amount: Exemption from 6% state sales tax on solar energy equipment
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Solar PV panels, solar thermal collectors, and related equipment
state_rebate_programs.details: Florida exempts solar energy systems from the state's 6% sales tax, providing significant savings on equipment costs.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Florida Department of Economic Opportunity, through community action agencies
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair/replacement, duct sealing, window film, solar screens, attic ventilation
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households. Florida's program emphasizes cooling load reduction including duct repair, insulation, and solar shading.

programs.name: Home Energy Survey
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive energy assessment identifying efficiency improvement opportunities

programs.name: Building Envelope Program
programs.amount: Up to $1,335 for ceiling insulation; up to $150 for duct repair
programs.eligible_items: Ceiling insulation, duct system testing and repair

programs.name: Residential AC Rebate
programs.amount: Up to $377 for qualifying high-efficiency systems
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency central air conditioning systems meeting minimum SEER requirements

programs.name: Home Energy House Call
programs.amount: Free in-home energy assessment with installation of free efficiency measures
programs.eligible_items: Energy assessment plus free LED lighting, water heater wrap, faucet aerators, showerheads

programs.name: Residential HVAC Rebates
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency central air conditioning systems and heat pumps

programs.name: Ceiling Insulation Rebate
programs.eligible_items: Ceiling/attic insulation meeting minimum R-value requirements

programs.name: Conservation Rebate Programs
programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $477 for qualifying HVAC
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency air conditioning, ceiling insulation, duct repair, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: Free Energy Audit
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy assessment with efficiency recommendations

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Varies; up to $300 for HVAC, up to $200 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, insulation, duct sealing, solar water heating
